result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Krystal B McGillis

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Krystal B McGillis not in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Krystal B McGillis. Attorney Jon Josephsen appeared on behalf of  Attorney Abby Rockendorf for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.

Defendant Krystal B McGillis in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Alexander Dyer for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel informs court that they are in a resolution posture. Court adjourns matter for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Krystal B McGillis in court, via zoom, with attorney Fred Richardson.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State, but need additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant/Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

Defendant Krystal B McGillis in court with Attorney Fred Richardson; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Kresa.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($750.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

OFF THE RECORD: 
Defendant Krystal B McGillis appears  in person.  
Imposed but stayed warrant is cancelled. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant does not appear. Court will impose, but stay a bench warrant until 5pm today.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Krystal B McGillis in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Krystal B McGillis in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Krystal B McGillis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
